answers.a: Poor contact between the push button and the breadboard, solved by checking and fixing the wiring
answers.b: Incorrectly calculating resistor values, solved by referring to the datasheet and online resources

questions.question: 9) What is the main advantage of using a microcontroller to control the LED blinking?

answers.a: Precise control over the blinking frequency
answers.b: More reliable than using discrete components
answers.c: Can easily be reprogrammed for different applications

questions.question: 10) How could you modify the circuit to control multiple LEDs with the push button?

answers.a: Use a larger resistor in series with the LEDs
answers.b: Add more push buttons to the circuit
answers.c: Use a shift register or multiplexer to control the LEDs
